title.narrative: WFP - Humanitarian Early Warning Service (HEWS II)

description.narrative:
Early Warning has repeatedly been affirmed at the highest levels of the United Nations system as ‘the best way to avoid exacerbation of crises’. Early Warning is a critical element in humanitarian preparedness and emergency response, allowing large humanitarian actors time to prepare for and launch operations, mobilise resources and protect staff and beneficiaries.
HEWS II seeks to establish a system of collaborative monitoring and analysis to produce better warnings, linked with options for action, in order to allow humanitarian decision-makers to respond proactively and proportionally to risk. The HEWS II system will provide: • Access to a continuously updated global summary of emerging socio-political threats. • Earlier warning of threats warranting action. • Inter-agency consensus on threats in near-real time. • Reduced duplication of effort via shared, automated monitoring of open-source information.
